resources.string:

© 2013-2014 TecVis LP 
© 2014 FIM Research Center 

Contact: myStress@fim-rc.de 

FAQ (only available in german!): http://goo.gl/bkZkgF 

myStress source code is licensed under LGPL 2.0 license and soon hosted on Github. For more information on license terms, review license.txt! 

This Application was developed at the FIM Research Center in cooperation with the Elite Graduate Program Finance and Information Management. 

The objective of this research process is the unobtrusivly recognition and prediction of stress. 

NOTE that the authors assume no responsibility for any potential misuse of this software for spying purposes. The operation is exposed through notification bar icons in order to make users aware of ongoing recordings!

Shows a path of recent GPS recording. You can click on a marker for more information. You can center the map either on your current location or the last stored one (using the buttons on the top right). You can also switch between map or satellite view with the appropriate options menu item.

Start the recording and selecte the mode of the recording.

 -Remote- all collected data are uploaded within an 12-hour intervall to a GDrive, if a proper wifi connection is established

 -Local- all collected data are saved on the smartphone, however you frequently have to manually synchronise the data.

Shows the sensors available in local sensing mode.\nChoose the sensors you would like to record. Through the menu, you can select and unselect all sensors (for a clean sheet) as well as look at the sensor repository, giving you information on type, value ranges etc of the sensors that were discovered.

Shows the current values of the sensors being read in local mode.\nFrom here, you can either Exit the program (and stop the service) or simply stop the display with the BACK key!\nYou can also PAUSE or RESUME the measurement threads (this does not stop the service but halts the recordings only).
Shows a historical timeline of the sensor you just clicked on. You can change the number of historical values in the General Settings\nExit the timeline by using the BACK key!
Allows for sharing the data since the last synchronisation as a text file.\n\nYou can also manually set the last sync date, in case you need to re-sync periods.

Thank you very much for your participation at our research project. 

This Application was developed at the FIM Research Center in cooperation with the Elite Graduate Program Finance and Information Management. 

The objective of this research process is the unobtrusivly recognition and prediction of stress. 

The current version of myStress records on the one hand the source for stress and on the other hand the felt stress level to detected stress relevent charateristics. 

After the first start, myStress is running in background and records within 6-minute intervall the values of the integrated sensors. 

Three times daily, the user is asked to answer four short questions about his current stress level. 


For further questions please have a look at the FAQ (only available in german!) http://goo.gl/bkZkgF or send an email to myStress@fim-rc.de
Exit will stop your recording and close the background service!\nAre you sure you want to exit?
Nothing to share, it seems! Have you set the camera path to the right one (the path need to the SAME as shown for pictures in the Gallery applications!).
myStress has been running.\nDo you want to interrupt the current recording and start over? You will need to start myStress again.
Started myStress local service!\nYou can see its current view by clicking on the notification bar update.
Started myStress remote service!\nValues will be uploaded constantly\nYou can see its current view by clicking on the notification bar update.
You can set the last sync date here (starting at 00:00 in the morning). It will overwrite your current sync timestamp!
Do you want to interrupt synchronisation?
There are no values to synchronise!
You have selected regular uploads in your general settings and can therefore not manually synchronise!
If you want to re-sync, set sync date from the Options menu!
Select a picture from the camera directory to determine the correct camera path!
Calculates the activity of the user based on the movement of the mobile phone
Provides the estimated audio frequency, determining the sound pitch. Measured in Hz.
Provides the estimated noise level, measured in dB.
Analysis of audio signal during call.
Provides information about the BT devices around, such as MACs and BT names.
Provides the number of BT devices around.
Provides the BT device(s) the phone is connected to.
Provides blood pressure values that are annotated by the user through the blood pressure phone widget.
Provides the current calendar event(s) from the selected calendar(s).
Provides the roaming status (0 if not roaming, 1 if roaming).
Provides the status of GPRS (0 if off, 1 is on).
Provides the strength of the cellular signal in dBm with -113dBm meaning \'no signal\'.
Provides the strength of the cellular signal in number of bars.
Provides the current cell identifier as given by the mobile operator.
Provides the current location area code as given by the mobile operator.
Provides the current mobile country code as given by the mobile operator.
Provides event descriptions annotated by the user through the Event Widget.
Provides text shared to myStress from any application that allows it.
Provides a combined Long:Lat:Alt string for GPS.
Provides the heading based on GPS with 0 degrees being North.
Provides speed in meters-per-second based on GPS.
Provides heart rate/pulse through the Zephyr HxM monitor.
Provides speed in meter-per-second through the Zephyr HxM monitor.
Provides the battery level of the Zephyr HxM monitor.
Provides filenames of media newly created within the pre-defined folder, such as for detecting snapshots taken.
Provides mood as selected or created by the user through the Mood Widget.
Provides information about the music playing (artist:album:track).
Provides artist for the current music track.
Provides album name for the current music track.
Provides name for the current music track.
Provides information on notifications from Skype and Google Hangout.
Determines length of each text input.
Provides the phone\'s azimuth - the angle towards the magnetic pole.
Provides the phone\'s rotation angle on the short axis relative to when laying flat and upward facing.
Provides the phone\'s rotation angle on the long axis relative to when laying flat and upward facing.
Provides proximity of any object towards the phone\'s front (usually upper side of) screen.
Provides the light intensity as measured by the phone\'s sensor.
Provides the call log and the call duration.
Provides the atmospheric pressure as measured by the phone\'s sensor (if available).
Provides the step count for the recording day.
Provides the ambient temperature measured by phone\'s sensor (if available).
Provides the ambient relative humidity measured by phone\'s sensor (if available).
Provides a random value, mainly used for testing purpose.
Provides the phone battery charging status (0-if not charging; 1-if charging).
Records if anything is plugged in into the headset plug.
Provides information about an incoming call: phone number and contact name (if in phonebook).
Provides information about an outgoing call: phone number and contact name (if in phonebook).
Provides information about a received sms: phone number, contact name (if in phonebook) and message.
Provides information about a sent sms: phone number, contact name (if in phonebook) and message.
Provides currently running applications on the phone.
Provides currently running applications on the phone requiring user interactions.
Provides the current myStress recording template.
Provides the current timezone offset in relation to UTC.
Provides the Celsius temperature as obtained from external web server.
Provides the Fahrenheit temperature as obtained from external web server.
Provides the humidity as obtained from external web server.
Provides a summarized weather info as obtained from external web server.
Provides the wind speed as obtained from external web server.
Provides a combined weather info as obtained from external web server.
Provides combined info about available WiFis.
Provides MAC addressed of available WiFis.
Provides signal strength info of available WiFis.
Provides status information (1 if phone is connected to a WiFi).
To ensure that the application is working correctly, we would like you to activate the accessibility service.
Wie oft hatten Sie seit dem letzten Messpunkt das Gefühl, …
… die Kontrolle über wichtige Dinge zu verlieren?
… sicher mit Ihren Aufgaben und Problemen umgehen zu können?
… dass die Dinge nach Ihren Vorstellungen verlaufen?
… die Fülle an Aufgaben/Problemen nicht mehr bewältigen zu können?
